headline: Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern file historic rail merger application
summary: Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern file a comprehensive merger application with the Surface Transportation Board to create America’s first transcontinental railroad. The post Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern file historic rail merger application appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Here’s Who Wins From North American Rail Integration
summary: North American freight rail is undergoing a quiet transformation. After decades of incremental consolidation, the industry now faces a strategic question: who benefits most from cross-border trade integration? The 2023 merger of Canadian Pacific and Kansas City Southern created the continent’s only single-line Mexico-Canada-U.S. rail network. We looked at three major freight carriers to see ... Here’s Who Wins From North American Rail Integration

headline: Creating America’s First Transcontinental Railroad: Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern’s STB Merger Application Details Enhancements to Competition and Public Benefits
summary: OMAHA, Nebraska & ATLANTA, December 19, 2025--Union Pacific Corporation (NYSE: UNP) and Norfolk Southern Corporation (NYSE: NSC) today filed an application with the Surface Transportation Board (STB) requesting approval to combine the two railroads. The companies entered into a merger agreement on July 29, 2025, to create America’s first transcontinental railroad.

raw.headline: Creating America’s First Transcontinental Railroad: Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern’s STB Merger Application Details Enhancements to Competition and Public Benefits

The companies entered into a merger agreement on July 29, 2025, to create America’s first transcontinental railroad.

headline: Wall Street banked on a flurry of deals under Trump in 2025. It wasn't that simple
summary: Dealmakers expected a flood of M&A to take place in 2025 following the election of President Trump. The number of transactions didn't live up to the hype.

headline: Merger Arbitrage: Riding The Wave Into 2026
summary: When it comes to mergers and acquisitions (M&A), 2025 has seen the most activity and some of the strongest returns since the post-pandemic period when dealmaking soared.
